body: @ncw This looks to be a regression from the PR adding support for multiple listeners and using the same variable for both the client & server: https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blame/496ae8adf62b0e3a4ea304ab4ff39358ebdfbec5/lib/http/server.go#L96
Missed it when `--url` became the recommended parameter instead of `--rc-addr` for connecting to a specific rc server ... üòÑ
Probably copied from @animosity22  a few years back and never updated those. Will raise an issue in his repo for updating those.

On second thought, this still deserves a fix or atleast a release note since the `setAlternateFlag` for mapping `rc-addr` to `url` doesn't work anymore due to different types: https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/496ae8adf62b0e3a4ea304ab4ff39358ebdfbec5/cmd/rc/rc.go#L121

When did that change? I've been using that for some time and realized it actually doesn't work today.

```
felix@gemini:~/scripts$ rclone rc core/gc --rc-addr 127.0.0.1:5574
2022/12/20 15:08:14 Failed to rc: connection failed: Post "http://[127.0.0.1:5574]/core/gc": dial tcp: lookup 127.0.0.1:5574: no such host
felix@gemini:~/scripts$ netstat -an | grep 5574
tcp        0      0 127.0.0.1:5574          0.0.0.0:*               LISTEN
felix@gemini:~/scripts$ rclone rc core/gc --url 127.0.0.1:5574
{}
```

I use to toggle debug too and that worked without issue prior as well:

```
felix@gemini:~/scripts$ cat rclone-debug
rclone rc options/set --json '{"main": {"LogLevel": "DEBUG"}}'  --rc-addr 127.0.0.1:5574
#rclone rc options/set --json '{"main": {"LogLevel": "DEBUG"}}'  --rc-addr 127.0.0.1:5575
```

Just this release. It worked fine with the prior releases.

Support for multiple listening addresses/sockets was added in this release and since the same parameter was used for both server & client (as an alternate flag), it broke the client connectivity.

The `addr` parameter is now an array of strings whereas the `url` parameter is a single string and copying the value as-is is causing an issue.

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/496ae8adf62b0e3a4ea304ab4ff39358ebdfbec5/lib/http/server.go#L96

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/496ae8adf62b0e3a4ea304ab4ff39358ebdfbec5/cmd/rc/rc.go#L40

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/496ae8adf62b0e3a4ea304ab4ff39358ebdfbec5/cmd/rc/rc.go#L121
Yes this looks like a regression. Want to prepare a PR @darthShadow ?

Assuming the fix is to just use the first value from the rc-addr array?

If so, will send a PR in a few hours.

issue.title: rc: set url to the first value of rc-addr -- fixes #6641

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
rc: set url to the first value of rc-addr since it has been converted to an array of strings now 

Signed-off-by: Anagh Kumar Baranwal <6824881+darthShadow@users.noreply.github.com>
